intro: Castilleja toluccensis, commonly known as Toluca Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange tubular flowers. The plant lacks true leaves and relies on host plants for nutrients, often growing on grasses or shrubs. Its unique structure and color make it a striking addition to its native habitat. Castilleja toluccensis is typically found in open, sunny areas with well-drained soils.
